name: The Talbot Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know it sounds like a lot of money, but let me explain....
reviews.title: £210 for 2 glasses of champagne!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled across the delightful Talbot Inn quite by accident. We decided to take a break from the tedious drive back to London. We found the Talbot and decided to have a glass of bubbly. Whilst we were enjoying the open fire, a gentleman came over to say hello (I am sorry, but his name escapes me). He explained he was the new manager as he had only been there a few days, he would love to hear any comments we had. He left but popped back about half an hour later. We got chatting about food & local produce and how good the menu looked. We had a look in the restaurant and it was amazing! There are these huge glass doors and a very impressive copper ceiling!. We had a look at the rooms as well and decided to stay over. It was a little more expensive than we were expecting but all the rooms are all brand new as they have only been open a few weeks. The menu and food was easily of London standard but the most impressive thing was the friendly and efficient staff and most of all, a manager who cares! We mentioned it was my birthday and I half expected the customary candle in my pudding or a glass of something but it didn't happen. On returning to our room, I found the nicest little thoughtful touch; the manager had put some lighted tealights and strawberries on ice in the room. There was even a card from him & his team!
reviews.title: Excellent Michelin Starred Chef Restaurant with Rooms

likes.liked: — The quality of the food in the resaurant and the clean rooms!
likes.disliked: — The heating goes off at night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled across this charming hotel by mistake - we were doing a bit of sight seeing before leaving the uk and what a wonderful wrong turn it was.
reviews.title: Wonderful & Relaxing stay in beautiful surroundings!!

reviews.text: We were pleased to find that the Hotel had a room for the evening at a very good rate and so after a friendly welcome at the reception desk we went straight to our room.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found our bedroom to be a very good size it was spacious and stylish, we loved the original characteristic of the room that were inkeeping with the building. The solid furniture with the neutral colourings gave it a calming and relaxing feel immediately. The bed was comfortable with lovely large pillows and we had all of the modern amenities that people now expect in Hotel rooms including wi-fi access which we find very important as we are always need to get on the internet for some reason. The bathroom was also a very good size with fantastic good quality towles that were thick and fluffy (instead of worn and thinning like you often get!!) I enjoyed using the toiletries as they smelt divine and seemed to be good quality also. I found the bedroom and bathroom to be exceptionally clean - which is something that I always look at. The rooms are beautiful, luxurious and romantic.
reviews.title: the wonderful talbot.

reviews.text: We decided to eat in the restaurant as the menu looked very apetising and there was so much to choose from so we headed down to the bar to have a little pre-dinner drink. We found the bar very small for the size of the hotel but the service was very good and it had a nice atmosphere.
reviews.title: romantic, and free use of computer

likes.liked: — new, and in keeping with the building

reviews.title: Talbot Restaurant
reviews.text: Whilst enjoying a drink at the bar we had the pleasure of meeting the General Manager Mr Paul Dixon (charming man - who seems to be very interested in what his guests think of his hotel - he is very proactive in interacting with the guests which is fantastic as it always nice to meet the manager!) he asked how our room was and whether we were enjoying our stay so far and if we had any comments or feedback that we would like to share. We had a nice long chat with Paul in which he told us that there were plans to have a fully stocked bar outside in the summer, which is an excellent idea as they have a large lawn area that would be perfect for outdoor dining - Paul then excused himself and wished us an enjoyable meal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great value for money, we stayed 2 nights in a deluxe room for £165 booking through Mylaterooms.com. Lovely quaint room tastefully furnished. Restaurant is superb, and service is great. Had 2 meals there and they are of a very high standard. Also has a michelin starred restaurant a short walk down the road called Drakes which was also excellent. Only quibble, although not an issue for us was that our room looked out on to a busy road and was above the bar so had we wanted an early night it would have been too noisy for us, so if you are considering a quiet break here then ask for a room away from the bar and road.
reviews.title: Great pub with rooms and excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed at the Talbot twice and will be doing so many more times. A gem of a find, sympathetically, yet trendily renovated coaching inn. It has quirky rooms in the original part of the hotel, many overlooking the village high street and converted mews rooms with great linen and duvets and pleasant bathrooms.. A super place for dining as it has the old inn beneath the bedrooms and the new brick and glass conservatory bistro. Everything that you could need in delightful Surrey. Very close to Wisley. Staff very friendly and helpful, dining a treat both for Sunday lunch and evening meals and close enough to Heathrow to use, but I should not tell you that because don't want everyone using it, in fact why am I writing this review? Only one small point of dislike, that they do not include full English, just continental breakfast and pay extra for English which I find strange because Surrey is still in the UK!
reviews.title: Super place to stay and dine

reviews.text: This is without question, given the very affordable price, the most pleasant hotel I have stayed in. It was a pleasure not only to stay but dine here. The service is remarkable, personal and thorough. I would not hesitate at all in recommending the Talbot Inn. Our organisation are becoming very loyal to this hotel. This testament to their overall quality offering. Many thanks. I look forward to staying again with you soon.
reviews.title: Brrrrrrrrrrriliant!!!!

reviews.text: My colleagues and I enjoyed our return visit here. We were considering dining elsewhere but were convinced to eat there. The food was good and champagne even better! The rooms are very comfortable with soft mattresses, flat screen TVs and large modern showerheads. I would definitely recommend a stay here.
reviews.title: A very comfortable stay, friendly staff and attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after having booked in at the Half Moon Inn across the road from the Talbot which was so terrible we left without checking in. With 30 mins before we had to get changed for a Party we were stuck. Louise the receptionist at the Talbot was wonderful, helpful and sorted out a fantastic room at very good value. The room we stayed in was spacious clean and beautiful. The staff are all welcoming and friendly and the buffet breakfast included in the price has locally sourced produce and is excellent. We will def be back as they really know how to run a great hotel with excellent customer service and we know through experience that this is sadly lacking in some other places. The night we arrived they were running a Murder Mystery Party that looked great fun so we may go back to do that with friends. Can't reccomend more highly.
reviews.title: Wonderful customer service and lovely place to stay

reviews.text: Booked thru lastminute - very good rate, paid extra to stay in one of the deluxe rooms. Some rooms are in a new building, others like mine are in the older (16th Century?) part of the hotel. Room was very old, floors sloped all over the place, low beamed ceiling. Very tastefully furnished. Bed was the softest I've ever slept on - very cosy. Bathroom was similarly furnished with good quality fixtures and quality complimentary toiletries. Nice TV with dozens of channels, free wifi internet that didn't need setting up with passwords etc. Room I had was short on sockets - but not an issue. I ate in the restaurant which was also beautifully furnished, the food was perfect and the staff were very efficent and attentitive. Finally, the bar was lovely, average prices, all old oak beams, lods of character. I can't recommend this place enough - if you stay in the old rooms but have no opinion of the new ones because i didn't see any. 10/10
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, full of character, excellent food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love this little inn.. so charming and wonderful staff. Everyone was so pleasant and helpful. Great restaurant on site, really good breakfasts, nice place to eat outside and a charming little pub downstairs. You literally could just stay on the premises the whole time. We stayed in one of the newer rooms and it was nice. Shower only, but that was fine with me. No complaints, except that the A/C unit is a stand alone and a little difficult to figure out.. it did drip on our floor that night causing a wet spot.. but the staff were happy to remedy. Would definitely recommend this if you have an occasion to be in the area!
reviews.title: Darling! Darling! Darling!

reviews.text: I booked because of Trip Advisor reviews. I wanted an old English Inn as opposed to a modern chain hotel/Inn. I was not disappointed! The Inn is seriously old and has all the features you would come to expect. Low (very!) beams, lower doors!, nice cosy bar, lovely chioce of restaurant areas. Our welcome was friendly and genuine. The twin room booked was spotless, modern and had all you would need. It is also to the rear away from the, busy, main road with views to the fields which were full of rabbits!. However it is small! The beds too tight and too small. But then I have not slept in a single bed for years so I did feel unconfortable. Beware! the air con unit in the room can be noisy and as we did not know how to work it properly it blew in hot air! NOT what you need with 25 degree temps.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent friendly and efficent bar man made for a great bar. the dining room is lovely. ...modern or traditional. I choose the garden room which is my kind of style. The food is efficent and very good...for the price. We both had the fish and chips and cooked perfectly. Light dry batter with moist fish and perfectly cooked chips. All served piping hot. A nice touch is that the peas were ground as againt being a Heinz 57 baby puree . Very nice. Other dishes looked equally good. Yes....do eat here. Our waiter was a very friendly and pleasant guy from Egypt and he was very professional and attentive.
reviews.title: Welcome to REAL England!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was also excellent....I went, as I do at home, for the continental, and no complaints.
reviews.title: Beautiful, cosy and romantic with excellent restaurant

description: Completely transformed inside, yet retaining its original, historical features, this traditional coaching inn has been caringly restored to its former glory, with a modern twist. You’ll find a comfortable and friendly bar with open log fires, real ales & a mouth-watering array of food, including favourite pub classics and an innovative British-la-carte menu using locally sourced produce. We also have a fabulous new restaurant, featuring a stunning copper ceiling and glass conservatory overlooking the garden.
